how_notes_work.title: 📓 How Notes Work in Orchestrate
how_notes_work.body:
Notes are your system-wide scratchpad — for ideas, concepts, insights, fragments, or anything you want to remember or reuse. Think of it like your always-on second brain.

You don’t need to organize your notes manually. Just add them, and Orchestrate will help retrieve or connect them later using tags, keywords, and file search.

capturing_notes.title: ✍️ Capturing Notes
capturing_notes.body:
To capture a note, just say something like:

`Save a note about [insight]`

Behind the scenes, Orchestrate will call `json_manager.add_json_entry` and log your thought to `notes.json`. You don’t need to format it — the system handles it for you.

retrieving_notes.title: 🔍 Retrieving Notes
retrieving_notes.body:
You can retrieve notes by asking about topics you've saved, or by using tools like `search_json_entries`, `list_json_entries`, or `read_json_entry`. You can also search by tag — for example, 'insight' or 'creative'.

Try: `Search notes for insights about risk`
